content.text: Students write a short review about a topic of their choice.
Discuss the example review you have provided on the worksheet. You should ensure you use an up-to-date/topical subject for your review. Point out and discuss the main features of a review.

Instruct the students to select their own subject and write a review about it. As this activity is quite open, I suggest you set time limits for each stage. So, for example, give them ten minutes to decide on their topic and start writing.
You can review any grammar or vocabulary you think they might need at the start of the lesson.
Circulate and assist during the writing. You can put the reviews together and make a book at the end of the class or do some pair work with students checking each others work.
